conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true cutaway 3D model: walls have height/thickness, multiple wall faces are visible, and the view is angled with the ceiling removed to expose interior volumes.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion with readable corners and room volumes; clean cutaway. Minor simplification/imperfection in some wall junctions and opening detailing.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room layout and adjacencies match well (dining left, kitchen upper zone, living right, bedroom lower-left, bath core, stairs at right). Some mismatch in the wash-area/toilet subdivision and a few door/window placements/sizes relative to the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture and fixtures present: dining set, kitchen counters, living seating, bed, bathroom fixtures, stairs. Placement generally aligns to intended rooms; slight ambiguity/simplification in bath/wash-area furnishing.

visual_clarity.notes: Clear separation of walls/floors/openings; good visibility and lighting; no UI/text clutter. Minor rendering simplifications but no major artifacts.

detected_errors.description: Central wet-area layout appears simplified/merged versus the 2D plan's distinct Wash Area and Toilet configuration.
Some door/window positions and proportions do not perfectly match the 2D plan (openings appear approximated).
Opening/trim detailing is simplified, reducing precision in reading exact wall thickness and window dimensions.

summary: This is a valid, clean cutaway 3D conversion with strong overall layout fidelity, with minor inaccuracies in wet-area partitioning and some door/window placement/proportion details.
